fields.summary: [Java] AllocationManager: Allow managing different types of memory other than those are allocated using Netty

jacques-n commented on pull request #6204: ARROW-7538: [Java] Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6204#discussion_r366993860 ########## File path: java/memory/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/memory/AllocationManager.java ########## @@ -181,10 +181,14 @@ void release(final BufferLedger ledger) { /** * Return the size of underlying chunk of memory managed by this Allocation Manager. * + *

By default the requested size is the actual size of the memory chunk. + * However if concrete AllocationManager impl supports allocating different bytes of memory + * comparing to desired, it must also override the getSize() method; * @return size of underlying memory chunk */ - public long getSize() { - return size; + public long getAllocatedSize() { Review comment: Let's remove this method. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

jacques-n commented on pull request #6204: ARROW-7538: [Java] Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6204#discussion_r366993391
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/memory/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/memory/AllocationManager.java
 ##########
 @@ -53,19 +53,19 @@
   // see JIRA for details
   private final LowCostIdentityHashMap<BaseAllocator, BufferLedger> map = new LowCostIdentityHashMap<>();
   private final long amCreationTime = System.nanoTime();
-  private final long size;
+  private final long requestedSize;
 
 Review comment:
   This seems like a waste of heap space, no? Since AllocationManager is abstract, let's just make getAllocatedSize() abstract in the base class. If a child class needs to store the value, they can add the field. I didn't realize the waste on the initial patch, just now. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

walterddr commented on pull request #6204: ARROW-7538: [Java] Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6204#discussion_r367167199 ########## File path: java/memory/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/memory/AllocationManager.java ########## @@ -181,11 +179,11 @@ void release(final BufferLedger ledger) { /** * Return the size of underlying chunk of memory managed by this Allocation Manager. * + *

The underlying memory chunk managed can be different from the original requested size. + * * @return size of underlying memory chunk */ - public long getSize() { - return size; - } + protected abstract long getSize(); Review comment: Made this `protected abstract` ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

walterddr commented on pull request #6204: ARROW-7538: [Java] Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6204#discussion_r367167359 ########## File path: java/memory/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/memory/NettyAllocationManager.java ########## @@ -61,9 +61,14 @@ protected void release0() { memoryChunk.release(); } + /** + * Returns the underlying memory chunk size managed. + * + *

NettyAllocationManager manages memory chunk by the exact requested size. Review comment: is this description accurate? I am not sure but I also lean into explain a bit more: ```suggestion *

NettyAllocationManager manages memory chunk by computing the allocatedSize based on the requestedSize. Thus the allocatedSize should be returned instead of the initial requestedSize. ``` ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

jacques-n commented on pull request #6204: ARROW-7538: [Java] Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6204#discussion_r367174489 ########## File path: java/memory/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/memory/NettyAllocationManager.java ########## @@ -61,9 +61,14 @@ protected void release0() { memoryChunk.release(); } + /** + * Returns the underlying memory chunk size managed. + * + *

NettyAllocationManager manages memory chunk by the exact requested size. Review comment: Probably should be: NettyAllocationManager rounds requested size up to the next power of two. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

jacques-n commented on pull request #6204: ARROW-7538: [Java] Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6204#discussion_r367200300 ########## File path: java/memory/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/memory/AllocationManager.java ########## @@ -181,11 +179,11 @@ void release(final BufferLedger ledger) { /** * Return the size of underlying chunk of memory managed by this Allocation Manager. * + *

The underlying memory chunk managed can be different from the original requested size. + * * @return size of underlying memory chunk */ - public long getSize() { - return size; - } + protected abstract long getSize(); Review comment: Oh shoot, I just realized you're reducing visibility her on a public interface. You should keep this public. Sorry I missed this. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

fields.description: As a follow up to the review of ARROW-7329, we should clarify the different sizes (desired vs actual size) in AllocationManager: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5973#discussion_r354729754
fields.summary: Clarify actual and desired size in AllocationManager
